gyroEnable.description: Flag to enable gyro or not.

defocusLow.description: Defocus low for defocus value monitor

detectionType.description: DEPRECATED. Instead use VMInitState to control stable/unstable mode

VMInitState.description: Initial State of value monitor.Set it to VMSTATELOW/VMSTATEHIGH to get previous unstable/stable detector

enable.description: While absolute mode is enabled, i.e., enable=1, value monitor will use the the baseline value as a reference baseline. While absolute is disabled, i.e., enable=0, value monitor will adaptively update reference baseline according to the metafilter output (referring to frame2armed)

baseline.description: This parameter is utilized as absolute mode is enabled. While absolute mode is enabled, value monitor will use this parameter as reference baseline.

triggerThreshold.description: Threshold for the value monitor detection. The threshold is defined as the absolute difference between metafilter output and reference baseline.

consecutiveCountThreshold.description: DEPRECATED. Instead use highCountThreshold/lowCountThreshold based on VMInitSTATE. e residue is constantly above/below the trigger_threshold. While VM_DETECTOR_UNSTABLE is chosen, the counting threshold means the number of counts that residual(absolute difference between signal and baseline) is above the threshold. While VM_DETECTOR_STABLE is chosen, the counting threshold means the number of counts that residual (absolute difference between signal and baseline) is below the threshold.

frameToArmed.description: Number of frames for starting the scene change detection.

highCountThreshold.description: Counting threshold for the residue is constantly above the trigger_threshold.-1 means disabled. If VMInitState is VMSTATEHIGH, tuning this can hold the previous decision

lowCountThreshold.description: Counting threshold for the residue is constantly below the trigger_threshold.-1 means disabled. If VMInitState is VMSTATELOW, tuning this can hold the previous decision

enable.description: Flag to enable median filter or not.
Flag to enable moving average filter or not.

numOfSamples.description: Length of the moving average filter.

enable.description: Flag to enable IIR filter or not.

coeffNumerator.description: IIR filter coefficient in numerator. An first order IIR filter is designed, the coefficients in numerator and denominator are typically required. This parameter defines the coefficient in the numerator.

coeffDenominator.description: IIR filter coefficient in denominator. An first order IIR filter is designed, the coefficients in numerator and denominator are typically required. This parameter defines the coefficient in the denominator.

While VM_DETECTOR_STABLE is chosen, the counting threshold means the number of counts that residual (absolute difference between signal and baseline) is below the threshold.

frameToArmed.description: Number of frames for starting the scene change detection.

highCountThreshold.description: Counting threshold for the residue is constantly above the trigger_threshold.-1 means disabled. If VMInitState is VMSTATEHIGH, tuning this can hold the previous decision

lowCountThreshold.description: Counting threshold for the residue is constantly below the trigger_threshold.-1 means disabled. If VMInitState is VMSTATELOW, tuning this can hold the previous decision

enable.description: Flag to enable median filter or not.
Flag to enable moving average filter or not.

numOfSamples.description: Length of the moving average filter.

enable.description: Flag to enable IIR filter or not.

coeffNumerator.description: IIR filter coefficient in numerator. An first order IIR filter is designed, the coefficients in numerator and denominator are typically required. This parameter defines the coefficient in the numerator.

coeffDenominator.description: IIR filter coefficient in denominator. An first order IIR filter is designed, the coefficients in numerator and denominator are typically required. This parameter defines the coefficient in the denominator.

triggerThreshold.description: Threshold for the value monitor detection. The threshold is defined as the absolute difference between metafilter output and reference baseline.

detectionType.description: DEPRECATED. Instead use VMInitState to control stable/unstable mode

VMInitState.description: Initial State of value monitor.Set it to VMSTATELOW/VMSTATEHIGH to get previous unstable/stable detector

enable.description: While absolute mode is enabled, i.e., enable=1, value monitor will use the the baseline value as a reference baseline. While absolute is disabled, i.e., enable=0, value monitor will adaptively update reference baseline according to the metafilter output (referring to frame2armed)

triggerThreshold.description: Threshold for the value monitor detection. The threshold is defined as the absolute difference between metafilter output and reference baseline.

consecutiveCountThreshold.description: DEPRECATED. Instead use highCountThreshold/lowCountThreshold based on VMInitSTATE. e residue is constantly above/below the trigger_threshold. While VM_DETECTOR_UNSTABLE is chosen, the counting threshold means the number of counts that residual(absolute difference between signal and baseline) is above the threshold. While VM_DETECTOR_STABLE is chosen, the counting threshold means the number of counts that residual (absolute difference between signal and baseline) is below the threshold.

frameToArmed.description: Number of frames for starting the scene change detection.

highCountThreshold.description: Counting threshold for the residue is constantly above the trigger_threshold.-1 means disabled. If VMInitState is VMSTATEHIGH, tuning this can hold the previous decision

lowCountThreshold.description: Counting threshold for the residue is constantly below the trigger_threshold.-1 means disabled. If VMInitState is VMSTATELOW, tuning this can hold the previous decision

enable.description: Flag to enable median filter or not.
Flag to enable moving average filter or not.

numOfSamples.description: Length of the moving average filter.

enable.description: Flag to enable IIR filter or not.

detectionType.description: DEPRECATED. Instead use VMInitState to control stable/unstable mode

VMInitState.description: Initial State of value monitor.Set it to VMSTATELOW/VMSTATEHIGH to get previous unstable/stable detector

enable.description: While absolute mode is enabled, i.e., enable=1, value monitor will use the the baseline value as a reference baseline. While absolute is disabled, i.e., enable=0, value monitor will adaptively update reference baseline according to the metafilter output (referring to frame2armed)

baseline.description: This parameter is utilized as absolute mode is enabled. While absolute mode is enabled, value monitor will use this parameter as reference baseline.
